case_title: Bahadar Ali vs Collector, Gujrat And Others

charges.description: Fraudulent attestation of mutations Nos. 1588 and 1589 without the knowledge of the landowners.
charges.details: Bahadar Ali conspired with Consolidation Patwari Ziafat Abbas to attest mutations in the absence of the landowners, Habibullah and Rehmatullah.

charges.description: Misplacement and destruction of mutations Nos. 1588, 1589, and 1593.
charges.details: Bahadar Ali acted with mala fide intentions to eliminate proof of fraudulent activities.
Bahadar Ali displayed irresponsible behavior, dishonesty, and inefficiency as a government servant.

disciplinary_action.rules_invoked: West Pakistan Government Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1960

key_findings: Charges against Bahadar Ali were proven beyond doubt.
Appellant avoided hearings and failed to appear despite multiple opportunities.
Service record indicated prior misconduct, including allegations of bribery.
remarks: The appellant was deemed dishonest, unreliable, and unfit for government service.
